Pre-existing Condition.selected_text: under the Prior Policy , the Pre-existing Conditions Limitation will end on the earliest of:
Pre-existing Condition.content: If You become insured under The Policy on the Policy Effective Date and  within 30 days of being covered under the Prior Policy , the Pre-existing Conditions Limitation will end on the earliest of: 1) the Policy Effective Date, if Your coverage for the Disability was not limited by a pre-existing condition restriction under the Prior Policy; or 2) the date the restriction would have ceased to apply had the Prior Policy remained in force, if Your coverage was limited by a pre-existing condition limitation under the Prior Policy. 2) The time period in the  Notice of Claim  provision is changed to 20 days, if not already 20 days. 3) The following is added to the  Physical Examinations and Autopsy  provision:  "Such autopsy must be performed during the period of contestability and must take place in the state of South Carolina."

Pre-existing Condition.content: If You become insured under The Policy on the Policy Effective Date and  within 30 days of being covered under the Prior Policy , the Pre-existing Conditions Limitation will end on the earliest of: 1) the Policy Effective Date, if Your coverage for the Disability was not limited by a pre-existing condition restriction under the Prior Policy; or 2) the date the restriction would have ceased to apply had the Prior Policy remained in force, if Your coverage was limited by a pre-existing condition limitation under the Prior Policy. 2) The time period in the Notice of Claim provision is changed to 20 days, if not already 20 days. 3) The following is added to the Physical Examinations and Autopsy provision:  "Such autopsy must be performed during the period of contestability and must take place in the state of South Carolina."

qa_pairs.question: What is the Eligibility Waiting Period for Coverage according to the policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [8, 9, 22, 33, 34, 35, 54, 65, 66, 67, 70, 80, 81], the Eligibility Waiting Period for Coverage is stated as "None".

qa_pairs.question: What condition must be fulfilled by the policyholder if they cease to be Disabled and return to work for a total of 5 days or less during the first 6 months of disability?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [65, 66, 67], if the policyholder ceases to be Disabled and returns to work for a total of 5 days or less during the first 6 months that they are Disabled, the 6-month waiting period will not be interrupted. Except for the 5 days or less that they worked, they must be Disabled by the same condition for the total 6-month period. If they return to work for more than 5 days, they must satisfy a new waiting period.

qa_pairs.question: What is the condition for Waiver of Premium according to the policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [65, 66, 67], if Waiver of Premium is approved, it will be retroactive to the date the disability began. Premiums will be waived retrospectively once the policyholder has completed the 180-day waiting period.

qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [65, 66, 67], if the policyholder ceases to be Disabled and returns to work for a total of 5 days or less during the first 6 months that they are Disabled, the 6-month waiting period will not be interrupted. Except for the 5 days or less that they worked, they must be Disabled by the same condition for the total 6-month period. If they return to work for more than 5 days, they must satisfy a new waiting period.

qa_pairs.question: What are the events that could trigger the end of an employee's participation in this insurance plan, as per Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on page [11, 18, 19, 36, 49, 50, 77, 78, 86], an employee's participation in this insurance plan could end on the last day of the period for which premium contribution is required, the date their employer terminates their employment, the date they cease to be a Full-time Active Employee in an eligible class for any reason, or the date their employer ceases to be a Participating Employer.

qa_pairs.question: What types of retirement plans are excluded from this insurance plan, according to Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on page [11, 18, 19, 36, 49, 50, 77, 78, 86], a profit sharing plan, thrift, savings or stock ownership plans, a non-qualified deferred compensation plan, an individual retirement account (IRA), a tax sheltered annuity (TSA), Keogh Plan, 401(k) plan, 403(b) plan or 457 deferred compensation arrangement are excluded from this insurance plan.

qa_pairs.question: What rights does an employee have regarding contributions for the life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance coverage in this plan, as per Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on page [11, 18, 19, 36, 49, 50, 77, 78, 86], an employee has the right to make any contributions required to keep the insurance in force, the right to convert, and the right to name and change a beneficiary.

Elimination Period.selected_text: If You remain Disabled after the Elimination Period, and are earning more than 20% of Your Indexed Pre-disability
Elimination Period.content: Calculation of Monthly Benefit:  Return to Work Incentive:  How are my Disability benefits calculated? If You remain Disabled after the Elimination Period, and are earning more than 20% of Your Indexed Pre-disability Earnings, We will determine Your Monthly Benefit for a period of up to 12 consecutive months as follows: 1) multiply Your Pre-disability Earnings by the Benefit Percentage; 2) compare the result with the Maximum Benefit; and 3) from the lesser amount, deduct Other Income Benefits. The result is Your Monthly Benefit. Current Monthly Earnings will not be used to reduce Your Monthly Benefit.  However, if the sum of Your Monthly Benefit and Your Current Monthly Earnings exceeds 100% of Your Pre-disability Earnings, We will reduce Your Monthly Benefit by the amount of excess.

If You die after the Elimination Period, but before the minimum number of monthly benefit payments have been made, the remaining monthly benefit payments will be made to Your estate.

qa_pairs.question: What is the duration of the Elimination Period in this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [34, 37, 38, 39, 42, 47], the Elimination Period is 90 days.

qa_pairs.question: How are Disability benefits calculated if one remains disabled after the Elimination Period and earns less than or equal to 20% of their Indexed Pre-disability Earnings?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [34, 37, 38, 39, 42, 47], if one remains disabled after the Elimination Period and earns less than or equal to 20% of their Indexed Pre-disability Earnings, their Monthly Benefit will be determined by multiplying their Pre-disability Earnings by the Benefit Percentage.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if one's Current Monthly Earnings exceed 100% of their Pre-disability Earnings after the Elimination Period, even though they remain disabled?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [34, 37, 38, 39, 42, 47], if one's Current Monthly Earnings exceed 100% of their Pre-disability Earnings after the Elimination Period, their Monthly Benefit will be reduced by the amount of excess.

Elimination Period.selected_text: Your Occupation during the Elimination Period; and
Elimination Period.content: 1) Your Occupation during the Elimination Period; and 2) Your Occupation following the Elimination Period, and as a result Your Current Monthly Earnings are less than 80% of Your Indexed Pre-disability Earnings. If at the end of the Elimination Period, You are prevented from performing one or more of the Essential Duties of Your Occupation, but Your Current Monthly Earnings are 80% or more of Your Pre-disability Earnings, Your Elimination Period will be extended for a total period of 12 months from the original date of Disability, or until such time as Your Current Monthly Earnings are less than 80% of Your Pre-disability Earnings, whichever occurs first.

Benefit Percentage.content: 2) the Benefit Percentage applicable to You multiplied by the amount of Your Pre-disability Earnings on which premium for You has been paid; or 3) the Benefit Percentage applicable to You multiplied by the amount of Your Pre-disability Earnings.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Benefit Percentage applicable to the policy holder?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page 34, the Benefit Percentage applicable to the policy holder is 60%.

qa_pairs.question: How is the Monthly Benefit calculated for the policy holder?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page 38 and 39, the Monthly Benefit is calculated by multiplying the policy holder's Pre-disability Earnings by the Benefit Percentage (60%), then comparing the result with the Maximum Benefit. From the lesser amount, deduct Other Income Benefits. The result is the Monthly Benefit.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a maximum limit to the Seat Belt Benefit or Air Bag Benefit under this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page 42 and 73, for both Seat Belt Benefit and Air Bag Benefit, either an amount resulting from multiplying the Principal Sum by the respective Benefit Percentage is payable, or the Maximum Amount for these benefits.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: Waiver of Premium:  Am I required to pay Premiums while I am Disabled?
Waiver of Premium.content: Waiver of Premium:  Am I required to pay Premiums while I am Disabled? No premium will be due for You: 1) after the Elimination Period; and 2) for as long as benefits are payable.

qa_pairs.question: What is the waiting period for Waiver of Premium to begin?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page 71 attain Waiver of Premium, then there is no waivered for Waiver Right within the time limits described in such provision; and the Amount of Life Insurance that may be converted will be subject to the terms conditions Conversion Right.

qa_pairs.question: What age can an employee return to work to qualify for Waiver?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page 70 affected.

qa_pairs.question: When the Waiver of Premium cease?
qa_pairs.answer: If You attain Normal Retirement Age Disabled prior60, then the Waiver of Premium will cease. If You do not return to work in Eligible Class, coverage will end. However, You may be eligible exercise Conversion Right within time limits described provision, if You do so.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: To qualify for Waiver of Premium You must:
Waiver of Premium.content: Conditions for Qualification:  What conditions must I satisfy before I qualify for this provision? To qualify for Waiver of Premium You must: 1) be covered under The Policy and be under age 60 when You become Disabled; 2) be Disabled and provide Proof of Loss that You have been Disabled for 6 consecutive months, starting on the date You were last Actively at Work; and 3) provide such proof within one year of Your last day of work as an Active Employee. In any event, You must have been Actively at Work under The Policy to qualify for Waiver of Premium.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: If We approve Waiver of Premium, We will notify You of the date We will begin to waive premium. In any case, We will not
Waiver of Premium.content: When Premiums are Waived:  When will premiums be waived? If We approve Waiver of Premium, We will notify You of the date We will begin to waive premium. In any case, We will not waive premiums for the first 6 month(s) You are Disabled. We have the right to: 1) require Proof of Loss that You are Disabled; and 2) have You examined at reasonable intervals during the first 2 years after receiving initial Proof of Loss, but not more than once a year after that.

qa_pairs.question: When the Waiver of Premium cease?
qa_pairs.answer: If You attain Normal Retirement Age Disabled prior60, then the Waiver of Premium will cease. If You do not return to work in Eligible Class, coverage will end. However, You may be eligible exercise Conversion Right within time limits described provision, if You do so.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: If You fail to submit any required Proof of Loss or refuse to be examined as required by Us, then Waiver of Premium
Waiver of Premium.content: If You fail to submit any required Proof of Loss or refuse to be examined as required by Us, then Waiver of Premium ceases. However, if We deny Your application for Waiver of Premium, You may be eligible to convert coverage in accordance with the Conversion Right. If You cease to be Disabled and return to work for a total of 5 days or less during the first 6 month(s) that You are Disabled, the 6 month(s) waiting period will not be interrupted. Except for the 5 days or less that You worked, You must be Disabled by the same condition for the total 6 month(s) period. If You return to work for more than 5 days, You must satisfy a new waiting period.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: Benefit Payable before Approval of Waiver of Premium:  What if I die before I qualify for Waiver of Premium?
Waiver of Premium.content: Benefit Payable before Approval of Waiver of Premium:  What if I die before I qualify for Waiver of Premium? If You die within one year of Your last day of work as an Active Employee, but before You qualify for Waiver of Premium, We will pay the Amount of Life Insurance which is in force for You provided: 1) You were continuously Disabled; 2) the Disability lasted or would have lasted 6 month(s) or more; and 3) premiums had been paid for coverage.

Waiver of Premium.selected_text: What happens when Waiver of Premium ceases?
Waiver of Premium.content: What happens when Waiver of Premium ceases? When the Waiver of Premium ceases: 1) if You return to work in an Eligible Class, as an Active Employee, then You may again be eligible for coverage for Yourself as long as premiums are paid when due; or 2) if You do not return to work in an Eligible Class, coverage will end and You may be eligible to exercise the Conversion Right for You if You do so within the time limits described in such provision. Waiver of Premium.selected_text: Effect of Policy Termination:  What happens to the Waiver of Premium if The Policy terminates?
Waiver of Premium.content: Effect of Policy Termination:  What happens to the Waiver of Premium if The Policy terminates? If The Policy terminates or Your Employer ceases to be a Participating Employer before You qualify for Waiver of Premium: 1) You may be eligible to exercise the Conversion Right, provided You do so within the time limits described in such provision; and 2) You may still be approved for Waiver of Premium if You qualify. If The Policy terminates or Your Employer ceases to be a Participating Employer after You qualify for Waiver of Premium, Your coverage under the terms of this provision will not be affected.

qa_pairs.question: What is the method to determine Your Monthly Benefit?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [39], Your Monthly Benefit is determined by comparing the result after Other Income Benefits deduction with the Maximum Benefit. The lesser amount is then used to compare with Current Monthly Earnings. If their sum exceeds 100% of Pre-disability Earnings, Your Monthly Benefit will be reduced by the amount of excess.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if Your Monthly Benefit plus Current Monthly Earnings surpasses a certain percentage of Pre-disability Earnings?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [39], if the sum of Your Monthly Benefit and Your Current Monthly Earnings exceeds 100% of Your Pre-disability Earnings, We will reduce Your Monthly Benefit by the amount of excess.

qa_pairs.question: What factors are not considered in reducing Your Monthly Benefit?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [39], Current Monthly Earnings will not be used to reduce Your Monthly Benefit under this policy.

qa_pairs.question: What will happen if the sum of my Monthly Benefit, Current Monthly Earnings and Other Income Benefits exceeds 100% of my Pre-disability Earnings?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [39, 40, 43, 47], if the sum of Your Monthly Benefit, Current Monthly Earnings and Other Income Benefits exceeds 100% of Your Pre-disability Earnings, We will reduce Your Monthly Benefit by the amount of the excess. However, Your Monthly Benefit will not be less than the minimum benefit or the Minimum Periodic Payment (MPP), whichever is greater.

qa_pairs.question: Can my Current Monthly Earnings affect the Elimination Period?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [39, 40, 43, 47], if at the end of the Elimination Period, You are prevented from performing one or more of the Essential Duties of Your Occupation, but Your Current Monthly Earnings are 80% or more of Your Pre-disability Earnings, Your Elimination Period will be extended for a total period of 12 months from the original date of Disability, or until such time as Your Current Monthly Earnings are less than 80% of Your Pre-disability Earnings, whichever occurs first.

qa_pairs.question: What documents should I provide to support my claim?

Minimum Benefit.selected_text: If it cannot be determined that You were wearing a Seat Belt at the time of Accident, a Minimum Benefit will be payable
Minimum Benefit.content: If it cannot be determined that You were wearing a Seat Belt at the time of Accident, a Minimum Benefit will be payable under the Seat Belt Benefit.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Minimum Benefit payable under the Seat Belt Benefit if it cannot be determined whether the policyholder was wearing a seat belt at the time of accident?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5383491.pdf page 73, a Minimum Benefit will be payable under the Seat Belt Benefit.

qa_pairs.question: Under what circumstances is it determined that the policyholder was not wearing a seat belt at the time of accident?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5383491.pdf page 73, if it cannot be determined that the policyholder was wearing a seat belt at the time of accident, a Minimum Benefit will be paid. No explicit conditions are mentioned regarding how this determination is made.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a specific amount or percentage for the Minimum Benefit payable under the Seat Belt Benefit?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5383491.pdf page 73, no specific amount or percentage for the Minimum Benefit is mentioned. The document only states that a Minimum Benefit will be paid under the Seat Belt Benefit if it cannot be determined whether the policyholder was wearing a seat belt at the time of accident.

qa_pairs.answer: Based on Hartford Cert 5387491.pdf page [77, 78], Common Carrier means a conveyance operated by a concern, other than the Policyholder, organized and licensed for the transportation of passengers for hire and operated by that concern.
